meanings.definition: To speak mistakenly or in error.
meanings.sent1: I misspoke when I said the sky was green.
meanings.sent2: She often misspoke during her speeches.
meanings.sent3: The comedian intentionally misspoke to make the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her words misspoke the true intentions behind her actions.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's error in the equation misspoke the answer completely.

meanings.sent1: He misspoke about his whereabouts yesterday.
meanings.sent2: They all misspoke during the game of charades.
meanings.sent3: The detective realized he misspoke about the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph misspoke the memories of that day.
meanings.sent5: The broken compass misspoke the direction of north.
